item.title: Report E-2024100599
item.description:
Report E-2024100599

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-25T09:22:20+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-09
  • City: DAYTON
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: VEOLIA ES TECHNICAL SOLUTIONS, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 10/9/24, a drum from SD Myers was delivered to Veolia's ten-day in-transit facility and temporarily placed on the dock pending transfer to another trailer for final disposal. During the subsequent loading process for outbound transportation, facility personnel observed liquid on the floor near the drum's location. Upon investigation, it was discovered that a pinhole in the bottom chime of the drum had allowed its contents to leak. To address this issue, the following actions were taken: 1. The compromised drum was immediately overpacked to ensure safe continued transportation. 2. The affected concrete surface was thoroughly decontaminated in full compliance with the procedures outlined in 40 CFR ยง 761.79(b)(4). These prompt actions ensured the containment of the spill, the safe handling of the drum, and the proper remediation of the affected area, all in accordance with applicable regulations and safety protocols.

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-26
  • City: NORTH JACKSON
